(1) 3/4 - Incorrect because it does not consider that both alleles for the flower color gene must be recessive for the organism to have a dark yellow flower phenotype.
(2) 0/4 - Incorrect because it mistakenly assumes that no offspring will have dark yellow flowers when there is a possibility for it based on the Punnett square.
(3) 2/4 - Incorrect because it does not accurately represent the probability of offspring having a homozygous recessive genotype for the flower color gene.
(4) 1/4 - Incorrect because it does not account for the fact that all offspring produced by the cross have at least one dominant allele for the flower color gene.
